title: SMI Holdings, Inc Recalls Beef Products Due to Possible Salmonella Contamination
summary: WASHINGTON, March 16, 2018 SMI Holdings, Inc., doing business as Stampede Meat, Inc., a Bridgeview, Ill. establishment, is recalling approximately 484,800 pounds of beef products that may be contaminated with Salmonella, the U.S. Department of Agricultures Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. The...
